reviews.text: Customer service is terrible , and given the cost of travelling on this Victorian era train service makes my blood boil. The self service ticket machine was offline, the woman on counter service had literally just closed the shutter, I knocked on the window and asked for her help and she refused, what a poor way to treat a customer, but they know you have no alternative. Disgusted and shocked at such poor service , Neath train staff you should be ashamed, I would be, let’s hope you never need my help. Pathetic people

Staff are very helpful and trains are normally on time.
Plenty of seating area for people waiting for their trains.
The station houses two cafes and staff are pleasant at both cafes

On Tuesday there was trains cancelled so my disabled mother decided to wait in the snack cafe as she has a bad foot and bad back, meaning standing for long periods of time is very painful. After being sat down for no more than 5 minutes, a old short fat women working in the cafe decided to chuck out my disabled mother along with an elderly couple, both using walking sticks to assist with walking, meaning they had to stand for over 2 hours in order to wait for a replacement train. Unacceptable.
Cafe on site while you waiting, but even better wetherspoons across the street.
I like this station, there are not a lot of facilities but good parking, good coffee and convenient.
